Subject: Writing Group 101
Description: How to Survive and Thrive in a Writing Group   Speakers include:Christian Klaver, David Erik Nelson, Cindy Spencer Pape - Track: Literature  - Duration: 50 minutes - Audio/video needs: none

Subject: Evoking Emotions, Provoking Readers
Description: Creating authentic characters who seem to experience a full range of believable emotions is only half the equation in character-building.  How can we use character emotions to evoke real feelings in our readers? What other tricks are there?  Speakers include:Merrie Haskell, Cindy Spencer Pape, Ken MacGregor, Cathrynne Valente - Track: Literature  - Duration: 50 minutes - Audio/video needs: none

Subject: Character Problems â€“ What's an Author to Do?
Description: A main character needs to start out annoying, boring, or unappealing. (they have to grow from somewhere!) Your readers say 'ugh' and set your book aside. What's an author to do? How do we avoid this? Examples?  Speakers include:Stacy Bender, Mary Lynn Gibbs, Paul Kemner, Emmy Jackson, Cindy Spencer Pape - Track: Literature  - Duration: 50 minutes - Audio/video needs: none

Subject: Mechanics of Magic in Fantasy & SF
Description: Does a magical system for a story need rules? Costs, unintended consequences, social factors? What about reliability issues? How can we avoid worn-out tropes. How should magic in an RPG and story differ? Is some of the tech in SF 'magic' and should the same considerations apply?  Speakers include:Paul Kemner, Cindy Spencer Pape, Ericka Kahler, Eric S. Raymond, Cathrynne Valente - Track: Literature  - Duration: 50 minutes - Audio/video needs: none
